gov.anl.ipns.Util.File
Class TextFileReader

java.lang.Object
  gov.anl.ipns.Util.File.TextFileReader

public class TextFileReader
extends java.lang.Object

This class supports reading of Strings, floats, ints etc. from an ordinary text file. In addition to methods to read each of the basic data types from the file, there is an "unread" method that restores the last non-blank item that was read. Error handling and end of file detection are done using exceptions.

Constructor Detail

TextFileReader

public TextFileReader(java.lang.String file_name)
               throws java.io.IOException
Construct a TextFileReader to read from the specified file. The constructor will throw an exception if the file can't be opened. The other methods of this class should not be used if the file can't be opened.

Parameters:
file_name - The fully qualified file name.
Throws:
java.io.IOException

TextFileReader

public TextFileReader(java.io.InputStream stream)
               throws java.io.IOException
Construct a TextFileReader to read from the specified byte stream. NOTE: If the close method is invoked the readers constructed by this object will be closed, but the InputStream passed to this constructor will NOT be closed.

Parameters:
stream - The byte stream from which to read data.
Throws:
java.io.IOException

TextFileReader

public TextFileReader(java.io.Reader stream)
               throws java.io.IOException
Construct a TextFileReader to read from the specified character stream. NOTE: If the close method is invoked any reader constructed by this object will be closed, but the Reader passed to this constructor will NOT be closed.

Parameters:
stream - The character stream from which to read data.
Throws:
java.io.IOException
Method Detail

eof

public boolean eof()
Check for the end of file. This eof() method just checks the look ahead character. If it is -1, the end of file has been reached. NOTE: This may be misleading, since there may just be whitespace remaining in the file.

Returns:
true if the last character has been read from the file.

end_of_data

public boolean end_of_data()
Check for the end of non-blank characters in the file. This end_of_data() method will skip any blanks starting at the current position in the file and will advance to the first non-blank character remaining in the file, if there is one. If there is a non-blank character remaining in the file, end_of_data() will return false and that non-blank character will be the next character read from the file. If no non-blank characters remain, end_of_data() returns true. NOTE: This changes the current postion in the file.

Returns:
true if no non-blank characters remain past the current position in the file.

read_line

public java.lang.String read_line()
                           throws java.io.IOException
Read one line from the file, starting at the current position in the file.

Returns:
The remaining characters on the current line of the file if there is one.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - with the message TextFileReader.EOF, if the end of file has been reached.

skip_blanks

public void skip_blanks()
                 throws java.io.IOException
Skip whitespace characters in the file, starting at the current position, stopping at the first non-blank character. The first non-blank character encountered is placed back in the file and will be the next character read.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - with the message TextFileReader.EOF, if the end of file has been reached.

read_String

public java.lang.String read_String()
                             throws java.io.IOException
Read a sequence of non-whitespace characters from the file, starting at the current position in the file. If the current position in the file is a whitespace character, whitespace characters will be skipped until the first non-whitespace character is encountered. After reading the squences of non-whitespace characters, the following whitespace character is read and NOT putback in the stream.

Returns:
The first non-blank sequence of characters encountered, starting from the current position.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - with the message TextFileReader.EOF, if the end of file has been reached.

read_String

public java.lang.String read_String(int n_char)
                             throws java.io.IOException
Read a sequence of characters from the file, starting at the current position in the file. This is intended for use with fixed format files.

Parameters:
n_char - The number of characters to read in.
Returns:
A String consisting of the specified number of characters.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - with the message TextFileReader.EOF, if the end of the file has been reached or TextFileReader.EOL if the end of the line has been reached.

read_int

public int read_int()
             throws java.io.IOException,
                    java.lang.NumberFormatException
Read a sequence of non-whitespace characters from the file, starting at the current position in the file and construct an int value from the the characters, if possible.

Returns:
The int value represented by the next sequence of non-blank characters in the file.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - with the message TextFileReader.EOF, if the end of file has been reached.
java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the characters don't represent an int.

read_int

public int read_int(int n_char)
             throws java.io.IOException,
                    java.lang.NumberFormatException
Read a sequence of characters from the file, starting at the current position in the file and construct an int value from the the characters, if possible.

Parameters:
n_char - The number of characters to read in.
Returns:
The int value represented by the next sequence of characters in the file.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - with the message TextFileReader.EOF, if the end of the file has been reached or TextFileReader.EOL if the end of the line has been reached.
java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the characters don't represent an int.

read_boolean

public boolean read_boolean()
                     throws java.io.IOException
Read a sequence of non-whitespace characters from the file, starting at the current position in the file and construct a boolean value from the the characters.

Returns:
The boolean value represented by the next sequence of non-blank characters in the file. The value is "true" if the sequence of non-blank characters matches "true" ignoring case and is false otherwise.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - with the message TextFileReader.EOF, if the end of file has been reached.

read_boolean

public boolean read_boolean(int n_char)
                     throws java.io.IOException
Read a sequence of characters from the file, starting at the current position in the file and construct a boolean value from the the characters.

Parameters:
n_char - The number of characters to read in.
Returns:
The boolean value represented by the next sequence of characters in the file. The value is "true" if the sequence of non-blank characters matches "true" ignoring case and is false otherwise.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - with the message TextFileReader.EOF, if the end of the file has been reached or TextFileReader.EOL if the end of the line has been reached.

read_char

public char read_char()
               throws java.io.IOException
Read the next character from the file, including blanks.

Returns:
The next character in the file.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - with the message TextFileReader.EOF, if the end of file has been reached.

unread

public void unread()
            throws java.io.IOException
Put the last float, double, int, boolean, char or String read from the file, back into the file so that it can be read again.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - if something goes wrong when trying to reset the BufferedReader.

           throws java.io.IOException

Throws:
java.io.IOException - if something goes wrong when trying to close the BufferedReader or FileInputStream.
